knimeNode.name: Deploy Workflow to Server
knimeNode.shortDescription: Deploys a workflow onto a KNIME Server.

p.i: For further information about file handling in general see the

intro.p: This node deploys a workflow from a port object onto a KNIME Server.

tab.name: Settings
tab.option: Enter a valid (absolute) path pointing to a folder / workflow group on the KNIME Server.
Select if the folders of the selected output location should be created if they do not already exist. If this option is unchecked, the node will fail if a folder does not exist.

Specify the behavior of the node in case the output file already exists.
Overwrite: Will replace any existing workflow.
Fail: Will issue an error during the node's execution (to prevent unintentional overwrite).
If selected the default workflow name, as shown, is used.
If selected the specified custom workflow name is used.

tab.name: Inputs and outputs
tab.option: Allows one to add input nodes connected to selected inputs prior writing. Depending on the selected node, there is a limited set of options available to pre-configure the node to be added. Furthermore, if tabular input data is stored with the input, it is used as examples input data for added input nodes.
Allows one to add output nodes connected to selected inputs prior writing. Depending on the selected node, there is a limited set of options available to pre-configure the node to be added.

tab.name: Deployment Options
tab.option: If checked, a snapshot will be created after the workflow has been deployed.
A customizable comment message that describes the created snapshot.

option.name: Update / disconnect links of components and metanodes

tab.option: If the workflow segment contains linked components or linked metanodes, these operations will update or disconnect (remove) these links. If both operations are enabled, the components/metanodes will first be updated and then disconnected.

ports.inPort: The connection to the KNIME Server onto which the workflow shall be deployed.
